sen.j: 金平（きんぴら）は、日本食の惣菜の一つ。
sen.e: Kinpira is one of Japanese side dishes.
Kinpira is one of Japanese side dishes.
Kinpira is one of Japanese side dishes.

sen.j: 繊切りにした材料を砂糖・醤油を用い甘辛く炒めるもの。
sen.e: It is a salty-sweet dish made by cutting ingredients into thin strips and stir-frying them with sugar and soy sauce.
It is a salty-sweet dish made by cutting ingredients into thin strips and stir-frying them with sugar and soy sauce.
It is a salty-sweet dish made by cutting ingredients into thin strips and stir-frying them with sugar and soy sauce.

sen.j: 材料としてはゴボウ、レンコン、ニンジンなどの根菜類が一般的だが、厚めに剥いたダイコンの皮や、ヤーコンなどで作っても美味しい。
sen.e: Root vegetables such as burdock roots, lotus roots, and carrots are commonly used as its ingredients, but it is good to use thick peel of daikon (Japanese radish) or yacon.
Root vegetables such as burdock roots, lotus roots, and carrots are commonly used as its ingredients, but it also tastes good with thick peel of daikon (Japanese radish) or yacon.

sen.e: Root vegetables such as burdock roots, lotus roots, and carrots are commonly used as its ingredients, but it also tastes good with thick peel of daikon (Japanese radish) or yacon.

sen.j: 味付はみりん（あるいは日本酒、砂糖）、醤油を基本とし、好みでトウガラシ、ゴマなどを加える。
sen.e: Basically, mirin (sweet cooking rice wine), or sake (Japanese liquor) and sugar, and soy sauce are used for seasoning, and if desired, red pepper or sesame is added.
Basically, mirin (sweet cooking rice wine) (or sake [Japanese liquor] and/or sugar), and soy sauce are used for seasoning, and if desired, red pepper or sesame is added.

sen.j: また、鰹節を使うやり方もある。

sen.j: 金平という名前は金太郎としても知られる坂田金時の息子・坂田金平から名付けられたという。
sen.e: It is said that the term kinpira was named after Kinpira SAKATA, a son of Kintoki SAKATA known as Kintaro.
It is said that the term kinpira was named after SAKATA no Kinpira, a son of SAKATA no Kintoki known as Kintaro.
sen.cmt: Kinpira SAKATA, Kintoki SAKATA を それぞれ SAKATA no Kinpira, Kintoki に修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that the term kinpira was named after SAKATA no Kinpira, a son of SAKATA no Kintoki known as Kintaro.

sen.j: 江戸時代はゴボウは精の付く食べ物と考えられていた為、強力の伝説で知られていた金平に仮託したもの。
sen.e: Since a burdock root was thought to be a nutritious food, people borrowed a name from Kinpira who was known for a legend of being strong.
sen.cmt: 「仮託する（ことよせる：他の物事を借りて言い表す）」を辞書で引いてもピッタリした英語が見つけられませんでしたので、「borrow (借用した)」と訳しています。
